alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Big Horn County through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Fort Smith, or 31 miles south of Hardin, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lodge Grass, Wyola and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
